results.title: Two songs by Dougie Young. Dread beat and blood
results.creator_credit: Franco Rosso, Michael Buckley, John Bird, Arts Council of Great Britain and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: Two Songs by Dougie Young (Melb., 1979, 7 min.): Aboriginal singer Dougie Young sings two of his songs as the basis of an animated film about aboriginal issues. “Dread Beat and Blood” (U.K., 1979, 47 min.): A unique combination of poetry, music and politics is portrayed in this film about black reggae musician Lindsay Kwesi Johnson.

results.title: Two songs by Dougie Young
results.creator_credit: Michael Buckley, John Bird and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: An original recording of aboriginal singer Dougie Young singing two of his songs has been used as the basis of an animated film which attempts to draw the attention of whites to contemporary aboriginal issues. “They say it’s a crime” describes an Aboriginals encounter with white law, “The land where the crow flies backwards” describes a displaced aboriginal culture.

results.title: Two sisters
results.brief_description: Viola lives her life in isolation, hiding her disfigured face from the outside world in a darkened room where she writes her novels. Marie, her sister and only companion, takes care of her every need, acting as her protector from the cruelty she perceives surrounds them. The two women happily live as co-dependant social pariahs until a male stranger arrives and throws their tenuous order into chaos. Caroline Leaf’s masterful animated short explores the psychological ramifications of isolation and the distortions it can create in a persons mind.

results.title: Two sides of the river
results.creator_credit: Brian Carson and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: The port of Echuca was once Australia’s largest inland port along the Murray River. This program looks briefly at life on the river in the early days and at the tourist attraction that the river and its boats have become.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Brian Carson and Victoria. Ministry of Education

results.title: Two pots, a caffe latte, a scotch and dry, a vodka lime and lemon, and a small antipasto with 5 forks
results.creator_credit: Matt Saville, Peter Tammer and Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television
results.brief_description: Waitress Elaine finds herself face to face with ex boyfriend, Rory, when he turns up to her yuppie watering hole for a drink. On her break she describes the decline of the relationship to her co-worker, and before the shift is over she is able to wreak revenge thanks to a stolen mobile phone and a cleverly procured visa card. Cast includes Caroline Bock, David Cotter and Elena Mendalis.

results.title: Two out of five
results.creator_credit: Francine Vande Wiele, Jean Calvell and Unesco
results.brief_description: Two out of five of the world’s population cannot read or write, and the campaign to promote literacy is of great importance for economic and social development. Scenes in African and Asian countries illustrate the great efforts being made in many underdeveloped areas.

results.title: Two out
results.brief_description: Utilising only one shot and a series of dissolves and jump cuts, this powerful short film examines the relationship between two men who share a single gaol cell. When the subject of the lack of the female object emerges, the tiny space they inhabit erupts into violence and frustrated desire.

results.title: Two of a kind
results.creator_credit: Brenda Horsfield, James McCloy and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man in the Making”
Discusses the similarities and differences, due to heredity and environment, to be seen in identical and fraternal twins.

results.title: Two nights
results.creator_credit: Rolmar Baldonado, Lisa Lloyd and AFTRS
results.brief_description: Over two nights, a young Chinese immigrant has sexual encounters with two very different individuals. Consequently, he has to choose between the one he wants or the one who wants him.

results.title: Two mules for Sister Sara
results.creator_credit: Don Siegel, Carroll Case, Martin Rackin and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Two Mules for Sister Sara is a freewheeling, anarchic adventure set in a French-occupied Mexico in the 19th century. An American mercenary (Clint Eastwood) rescues a nun (Shirley Maclaine) from her would-be-molesters, only to later discover that the chance meeting has been a stroke of luck for him, as she knows a great deal about the officers in the garrison he plans to invade. As they embark on a journey together, there develops a sexual tension between the two which comes to an explosive end together with the garrison under attack. Includes a musical score by Ennio Morricone.
